That night, the prime minister first explained the eight sufferings to the madam.
The first suffering he explained was the suffering of birth.
The suffering of birth refers to the body that is born.
It is entrusted to the mother's protection and dwells in the womb.
In the last month, it is like fresh butter.
Within ninety days, it can form a shape.ğŸ”½The boy is on the left side of the mother.
The girl is on the right side of the mother.
Sticking close to the heart and lungs, it receives the qi and forms a shape.
Then it undergoes various sufferings.
The wise and the foolish are equal, the noble and the humble are the same.
The kindness of a loving mother should not be of two kinds.
If the mother eats hot food, it is no different from boiling the body in a cauldron.
If the mother eats cold things, it is just like the cold ice hell.
If the mother eats until she is full, it is as if she is being squeezed in a vise.
If the mother is hungry, she experiences the suffering of being hung upside down.
After ten months, the time of childbirth is near.
The hundred bones and joints open up, as if being sawed apart.
The four limbs and body are broken, and the five internal organs are in excruciating pain.
It is no different from being cut by a knife.
How is it any different from being pierced by a sword?
Having died a thousand times and been reborn ten thousand times, one becomes unconscious and unaware of one's fate.
If one is like a hanging thread, one will not forget to revive again.
In an instant, the mother and child are separated.
The blood was like that of a slaughtered sheep.
The mother fainted and then asked, Is it a boy or a girl?
If it is said to be a girl,
Then the mother and child can be peacefully reunited.
If it is a boy,
In the midst of the pain of a hundred joints, she immediately smiles.
This is called a filial son.
If it is my disobedient child, how will it be born?
While in the mother's womb, it makes the mother uneasy.
Kicking and trampling the mother, never resting for a moment.
Suddenly at the heart, suddenly at the waist.
There is no place in the five viscera that it does not reach.
After ten months, it is born.
At that time, it holds the mother's heart and liver in its hands.
Its feet trample on the mother's hip bones.
For three days and five days, it is not peaceful.
From this, the mother's great life is turned upside down.
The mother, seeing that she is about to die, cries out in a voice that shakes the earth, as if a sword has reached her heart.
The brothers and mother do not know what to do.
Only when they have taken life can they stop.
Having already endured the child, they must later die.
This is precisely what it means to be born.
The Prime Minister is one such example.
He also spoke to the Lady about the suffering of old age. The suffering of old age is such that
a person's life of a hundred years is like a shooting star, in the blink of an eye.
By the time they are seventy or eighty, their energy and strength are waning.
Their former voice and appearance resemble spring flowers.
Now that old age has come, they are like autumn grass.
Their sinews, skin, and hair are about to wither and dry up.
Their eyes are dim and ears deaf, unable to distinguish blue and yellow.
Their four limbs are heavy and their hundred bones ache.
They are gradually moving away from heaven and should be close to the ground.
At night, they toss and turn a thousand times on their bed and pillow.
At that time, they are unable to attend to worldly matters as if in a dream.
If not for the peach and plum trees by the roadside blooming year after year,
with the sun shining on the river's face, where would they be now?
If old age and sickness come to invade,
there is no way to turn back the white hair.
The vigor of the past diminishes with the eight nodes.
The old red face changes with the four seasons.
This person is all old.
Nobles and humble are the same.
Not discriminating between wise and foolish.
This is the suffering of aging together, unlike what is heard.
One should early create fields of blessings.
Human life passes by in an instant.
One must be very attentive.
Then one practices cultivation.
Once the body is lost, there is no way to regain it.
This is called the suffering of aging.
The Prime Minister that night explained the suffering of illness to the Madam.
The Madam also heard it.
What is called illness?
The four places are large, but have never been real.
The combination of various conditions, earth, water, fire, and wind.
One vein not in balance is illness.
All arise suddenly, suddenly using heavy bedding.
The soul and spirit are uneasy, the five spirits are all lost.
The dry tongue shrinks, the brain hurts, the head aches.
Between the hundred bones and joints, it is like being sawed apart.
Suffering day and night without respite.
Unable to seek life or death.
The wonderful arts of the world only treat those with life.
How can one save those who are about to die?
Medicine cannot cure the damage.
For many days and nights, one suffers great pain.
Even if one uses the most potent medicine and the best acupuncture,
When death and illness come, there is nothing that can prevent them.
Worldly people foolishly accept false teachings. Before they are sick, they are already in bed, blaming ghosts and spirits, burning money to release prohibitions, and killing many beings.
Such people will fall into hell.
The maximum lifespan is no more than a hundred years.
Among ten people, seven die young. Only three live to be a hundred. Even if they live to be a hundred, how many years can they enjoy? If there were wonderful arts,
People should live a thousand years. Why don't they use their minds?
Foolishly accepting the deception of others, they are deluded.
This is called the suffering of illness.
Your Excellency, the suffering of the night is for the sake of the wife.
The four great elements are about to return to extinction, and the soul and spirit are destroyed by the wind.
Brothers say long farewells, and mothers are forever separated.
Wives, children, and family members have no way to reunite.
Friends and acquaintances come and go in an instant.
There is no way to see them again.
Gold, silver, money, and goods are left to be divided.
The shops and estates cannot be taken away.
The suffering of death and separation of the four great elements.
The soul and spirit fly away, and no one knows where they are.
The three inches of the dead is the next life.
When one person dies, when will they be reborn?
The living hear of heroes and discuss blessings and rewards.
Following karma, one receives it according to the realm assigned.
Either dwelling in hell, in heaven, as an animal, or as a hungry ghost.
The six realms revolve without respite.
Rarely obtaining a human body again among ten thousand.
This is called the suffering of death.
This is also true for the Prime Minister.
He also explained the suffering of the five aggregates to the wife.
The suffering of the five aggregates is as follows:
Human life in the world is like day and night.
Thick blood, skin, and brocade wrap the body.
Within the five aggregates, the seven orifices always flow.
Inside, harboring the stench of excrement, outside, wandering in blood and bones, looking at the pus-filled bag.
Snot and saliva flow day and night, everywhere unbearable.
Completely lacking the true nature one desires.
All arise from the breath of three inches.
This is the sprout of the three poisons.
The root of the five viscera and the five desires.
Therefore, the Great Master has a verse:
Thin skin covers pus and blood, sinews wrap the stinking bones.
From head to toe, observing,
The whole body is a thick flow.
Such is called the suffering of the aggregates.
Oppressing the body, this is called the suffering of the five aggregates.
Your Excellency, on this night, you also spoke for the Madam about the suffering of not obtaining what one seeks.
People in the world each have their own possessions.
Those who wish for blessings seek unsurpassed enlightenment.
Moreover, within the three periods of time,
Seeking to obtain the blessings of being born in the heavens.
How many can enjoy worldly glory?
If you seek human wealth and possessions,

Even if you obtain clothing and food to fill yourself, it is not enough.
Your mother and brothers each save and treat you.
Raising sons and daughters, you seek for yourself.
If you do not plant in your previous life, you will not cultivate for many eons.

Today's bitter advice, the listening assembly all knows that clothing and food are determined by past lives. The master has a verse:
This year's determination is to have.
Next year, how can you not plant next year's grain?
This life's determination is to have.
In the next life, how can you not cultivate?
The blessings of the next life are like this.
This is called the suffering of not obtaining what one seeks.
Tonight, Your Excellency, you also spoke for the Madam about the suffering of being with what is hated.
The suffering of being with what is hated is this:
People in the world have greed in their hearts.
Seeing others have wives, they want to seek wives.

they immediately give birth to sons and daughters.
This is a metaphor for what kind of pre-investigation?
If one plucks flowers, the butterfly will only circle in the sky.
Suddenly seeing a beehive,
it will immediately brush the fragrant stamens.
Unknowingly, a spider is on top of it.
Wrapping it around in a hundred turns and a thousand circles,
the butterfly is wrapped up in the middle.
With myriad calculations, there is no way to escape.
This is the pre-suffering.
Ordinary beings' love for form is also like this.
Seeing others young, they give rise to a mind of love and admiration.
As the years and months deepen, they eventually have sons and daughters.
Having grown up and become adults, they are unfilial to their parents and commit the five heinous crimes that fill the heavens.
Not befriending the wise, they associate with the foolish and do not understand the three ponderings before speaking. Their lips are foolish, and they involve their six relatives and elders.
If they stay at home, they immediately waste their mental and physical strength.
Or if going out, always worrying and fearing,
This is called giving rise to many enemies.
From generation to generation, there is no end.
Good causes and bitter admonitions, the listening assembly will know.
If wanting to have no enemies in the next life,
It is not as good as cultivating pure conduct in this life.
Enemies are forever separated, not surrounding the swollen mind.
The causes and conditions of men and women, how many are there?
The Great Master has a verse:
Since the distant kalpas, receiving deep suffering,
The six destinies revolve, everywhere going around.
If not fiercely cutting it off in this life,
When will the enemies' mutual retribution end?
This is called the suffering of encountering enemies.
Your Excellency, on this night, again speaking for the Madam about the suffering of separation from what one loves.
Like this, raising a son in the household,
The parents look at him like a pearl or jade.
When he grows up and becomes an adult, just able to distinguish east from west,
He immediately leaves his hometown and goes to another prefecture.
The parents day and night, with suspended hearts, look forward to him.
Every morning, she leaned on the door and cried sadly.
From this, thoughts of illness arose.
Looking at the medicine for sleep, when will she see me again?
Suddenly, in winter, on New Year's Eve, all six relatives were in front of her eyes.
Suddenly remembering the son outside, she choked with grief.
This is called the suffering of separation from what is loved.
The Prime Minister has already explained the eight sufferings that torment the mind.

Those born from moisture.

The first, those with form, see clay niches and sculpted images and immediately pay homage with sincerity, saying directly,

The third, those with characteristics,

they say the previous object has come to cultivate and enter the temple.

there is delusion.

Since there is ignorance, there are afflictions.
Since there are afflictions, there is sinking and revolving.
Since there is sinking and revolving, there is hell that binds the body and mind for many eons.

This is called having characteristics.
Fourth, the formless:
Myriad dharmas are all empty.
How have they ever been real?ğŸ”½There are no traces in the east or west,

Fifth, not having characteristics:
When speaking, there is speaking; when finished, it returns to nonexistence. When standing,

One should not believe that it exists, and it will immediately return to the nonexistence of myriad phenomena.

This is then called the non-existent characteristic.
Sixth, the non-characterized of nonexistence means:
No words, no speech, no going, no coming, no movement, no thought.
Not arising, not ceasing, this is true suchness.
No going, no coming, this is buddha-nature.

The great master has a verse:

Eighth, the four-footed one:

Ninth, the many-footed one:

Tenth, the legless one:

This is called having no legs.
